channel.title: Doesn't remember my video settings
channel.description:
Just built a new PC. Each time I start Black Mesa, it comes up in 1024 x 768 (3:4 ratio), and no AA. Each time I have to switch to 16:10, 1920 x 1200, 4xAA (etc). My system is easily powerful enough to handle these settings. But when I quit, it doesn't remember anything, and I have to do it all again next time I start.
NB: Doesn't happen for other Steam/Source games (tested Half Life 2 & Portal 2)
MoBo : ASUS P8 Z77-V LX CPU : i5 3570 @3.4GHz SDD : Intel 520 Series 240GB (Steam on this) HDD : Western Digital Caviar Green 2TB 64MB Cache GPU : ASUS GeForce GTX 670 DirectCU II OS : Windows 7 Home Premium 64-bit PSU : Seasonic X-650 Audio : Roland Quad Capture
Steam freshly installed & activated, SteamApps folder copied across

item.title: Doesn't remember my video settings
item.dc:creator: TrevorMag
item.description:
sersoft:

check your BMS shortcut and autoexec.cfg for commands like “dxlevel” and take them off

Thanks - that was it. I was experimenting with dxlevel settings on my previous (horribly underpowered) computer, and they got copied across (via the SteamApps folder)
